com.w2.api.engine.operators

Class RobotSensorHistory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w2.api.engine.operators.RobotSensorHistory

  • public abstract class RobotSensorHistory
extends java.lang.Object
    The `RobotSensorHistory` object contains a set of `RobotSensorSet` objects in reverse chronological order. New sensor data are coming in roughly every 30ms under normal conditions. However, depending on the signal strength of the robot, it may extend out to 40ms.

      abstract int getCount() 
      abstract RobotSensorSet getCurrentState()
      Returns the most recent `RobotSensorSet` object received from `Robot`.
      abstract RobotSensorSet getPreviousState()
      Returns the second most recent `RobotSensorSet` object received from `Robot`.
      abstract RobotSensorSet pastStateAtIndex(int index)
      Returns the `RobotSensorSet` object specified by index.
      abstract void setLimit(int newLimit)
      The number of `RobotSensorSet` objects to store.

      • getCurrentState

        public abstract RobotSensorSet getCurrentState()
        Returns the most recent `RobotSensorSet` object received from `Robot`. CurrentState is updated roughly every 30ms, depending on the signal strength of the robot.
        Returns:
        Returns the most recent `RobotSensorSet` object.

                                         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • pastStateAtIndex

        public abstract RobotSensorSet pastStateAtIndex(int index)
                                         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the `RobotSensorSet` object specified by index. If index is out of bounds or no `RobotSensorSet` is associated with the index, an exception is thrown
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the desired `RobotSensorSet` object.
        Returns:
        The associated `RobotSensorSet` object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
